title: How do I handle a 1099-C sent to my mother's estate (after her death) from a non-recourse reverse mortgage that was underwater?
question: My mother had a reverse mortgage on her home (primary residence) - where she lived for 30 years.
answers: Ignore it or write the IRS and the party that sent you the 1099-c and inform that they will not be able to recover as there were no assets left.

I think you already handled it by filing the final 1040. I don't know why the bank sent the 1099-C if they foreclosed on a non-recourse loan? Either way it doesn't really matter as it has already been finalized and there are no assets to deal with.
Ignore it or write the IRS and the party that sent you the 1099-c and inform that they will not be able to recover as there were no assets left.
